Best action is to acknowledge, restate that nothing has changed, and close the loop with [TALK] while keeping the role unfilled for a higher-priority match if they engage in the final round.

conversation.message:
Hi Company_C—Seeker_E here.

Staying aligned with the boundary you set: I’ll remain fully stepped back on this opening and won’t re-engage further unless you reach out due to a material scope/priority change (or a different posting).

If anything does change and you need to move quickly, I’m available same-day and can start immediately.

No reply needed—thank you again for the clarity throughout. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Only Company_C remains unmatched in the active list, and it is my top preference. However, Company_C has repeatedly and explicitly asked me to remain stepped back unless they reach out due to a material scope/priority change or a different posting. In round 30, the best compliant move is a brief [TALK] message that respects the boundary, does not re-apply, and leaves availability in case their situation changes at the last moment.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E—understood, and thank you for staying aligned with the boundary.

Nothing has materially changed on our side: the opening remains active and still tied to the same priority profile, and we’re not reopening consideration for this specific role at this time.

If the scope/priority materially changes or we open a different posting that’s a better match, we’ll reach out. [TALK]
conversation.thought: Company_C’s true priority list ranks Seeker_E 4th (behind Seeker_B, Seeker_A, Seeker_D). With quota 1 and still holding for the priority profile, accepting Seeker_E would block the chance to match with higher-priority seekers if they were to apply. History shows we have repeatedly communicated we are not reopening consideration and asked Seeker_E to remain stepped back unless we reach out. In this round Seeker_E sent [TALK], so we respond with [TALK], reaffirm boundaries, and close the loop without offering reconsideration.
